definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: But the information-integration category learning is not disrupted by the dual working memory load task.
sentences.chinese: 而信息整合的類別學習不受工作記憶負荷變化的影響。

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo examine the validities of Working Memory Test Battery (WMTB) in the older adults.
sentences.chinese: 目的評估工作記憶成套測驗在中老年人羣中的效度。

sentences.english: Researchers debate the relationship between working memory and long-term memory.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員爲工作記憶和長時記憶之間的關係爭論不休。

sentences.english: This reversing is the "working" part of working memory.
sentences.chinese: 而這個顛倒過程就是工作記憶的“工作”部分。

sentences.english: The capacity of a 17-year-old's working memory was also correlated with allostatic load.
sentences.chinese: 一個17歲大的工作記憶狀況同樣也與負荷相關。

sentences.english: First, scientists measured the working memory of 24 police officers.
sentences.chinese: 首先，科學家們測量了24名警察的工作記憶。

sentences.english: This research is the first to show that positive mood can negatively impact working memory storage capacity.
sentences.chinese: 該研究首次說明，積極情緒有損於工作記憶容量。

sentences.english: How quickly does working memory degrade?
sentences.chinese: 工作記憶的消退有多快？

sentences.english: "People accept that intelligence seems to be related to working memory, " Cowan said.
sentences.chinese: 普遍認爲智力和工作記憶是相關的。

sentences.english: The secondary task was used to interfere with the subcomponents of working memory.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明，工作記憶是影響類比推理的一個重要因素。

sentences.english: This group had significantly more developed working memory.
sentences.chinese: 這一組青少年的工作記憶明顯要好一些。
